title: Charles McLean (rugby union)
text:
Charles McLean (20 September 1892 – 7 March 1965) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. A <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Loose%20forward">loose forward</a>, McLean represented <a href="Buller%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Buller</a> at a provincial level, and was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, in 1920. He played five matches for the All Blacks, scoring seven tries, but did not appear in any internationals.
McLean enlisted for military service in August 1914, and served with the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Expeditionary%20Force">New Zealand Expeditionary Force</a> throughout <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>, including at <a href="Gallipoli%20Campaign">Gallipoli</a>. A private, he was awarded the <a href="Military%20Medal">Military Medal</a> in 1918, for acts of gallantry in the field.
McLean died in <a href="Christchurch">Christchurch</a> on 7 March 1965, and he was buried at <a href="Hokitika">Hokitika</a> Cemetery.
